div.head: TO THE RIGHT REVEREND FATHER IN GOD, AND his approoued good Lord, ROBERT Lord Bishop of Hereford, I. H. wisheth grace and happines.
div.p:
NO motiue of this world, but a strong perswasion of that zeale which preached to the heart, furnished the Church, and reformed the Country where I was borne, first submitted my seruice to your Lordships direction next vnto Gods, leading me to be trayned vp vnder your Lordship next vnto William of
Wickham: where the fauourable care that • ath beene taken for the conuenient supportation of mine earthen vessell, to the end it might beare heauenly treasure, agreeth rather with the nature of a Father, then the name of a Patrone: which as I haue been, and euer wil be ready to professe, so am I now, by this small pledge of my thankfulnesse, most willing to publish, though it cost me withall the publication of mine ignorance. God Almighty direct and protect your Lordship.

closer.signed: Your Lordships Chapellan in all duty to be commanded, I. HOSKINS.
